# Short Bio

I'm a [Computational Biologist]{.my_bold} :computer::dna: with research experience in Academia, Industry, and their interface. I've also served as a consultant and analyst in research projects involving multiomics analysis of complex biological data.

I'm currently doing my PhD, where I develop and apply computational methods to better understand the [microbiome-gut-brain axis]{.my_bold}. I work under the supervision of Professors John F. Cryan and Gerard Clarke at the [APC microbiome Ireland](https://www.ucc.ie/en/apc/).

In my daily life I like reading books (mostly non-fiction), hiking, drinking coffee and doing 3D design and printing.

# Research Interests

My research focuses in three areas:

::: bullet-list
-   Microbiome modulation of the gut barrier integrity and its effects on host gut-brain health.
-   The gut microbiome of underrepresented population and its implications on brain health.
-   Probiotics and Psychobiotics development.
:::
